overview_of_class: The course is an introduction to geographic information systems (GIS). The purpose of the course is to allow the students to master sufficient GIS concepts and applications to carry out a short research project that applies a GIS approach. Individual projects involve database manipulations including Census Tiger files, digital elevation models, and spatial statistics.
name: Geographic Information Systems
title: WCAS GEOG 343-0-20 Geographic Information Systems

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course is an introduction to geographic information systems (GIS). The purpose of the course is to allow the students to master sufficient GIS concepts and applications to carry out a short research project that applies a GIS approach. Individual projects involve database manipulations including Census Tiger files, digital elevation models, and spatial statistics.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
1. To utilize geographic information systems (GIS) for conducting spatial analyses.

2. To understand basic geographic information system terms and concepts.

3. To develop skills in the written communication of geographic information.

4. To understand a variety of spatial data models.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
1. 12 Mini-Lab Reports 60% of grade.
2. Individual GIS Project 20% of grade.
3. Exam 20% of grade.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Greene, R. P., and Pick, J. B. Exploring the Urban Community: A GIS Approach, 2nd Edition. Upper Saddle River, New Jersey: Prentice Hall, 2012.

ISBN: 978-0-321-75159-1
